alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 3:41AM EDT until April 02 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at GA 26 near Montezuma affecting Macon, Dooly and Sumter Counties. Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Upson, Crawford, Talbot and Taylor Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Bleckley and Pulaski Counties. Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Jones, Monroe, Bibb and Twiggs Counties. Oconee River at Dublin affecting Washington, Laurens, Wilkinson and Johnson Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Johnson Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lovejoy, Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Americus, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25 feet, Major flooding occurs. Most of Old Balls Ferry Road north of Georgia Highway 57 will be under one to three feet of water. The water level reaches the bottom of the USGS gaging equipment near the boat ramp. Widespread flooding up to several feet deep of the woodlands near the river occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 24.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM EDT Thursday was 25.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday morning and continue falling to 14.4 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 17 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
